title: Photographer Jeff Boyce's 70k shots of tornadoes, lightning and starry skies

Storm-chasing photographer Jeff Boyce has created this mesmerising highlight reel of some of the Midwest's most intense weather.
Travelling nearly 20,000 miles through 15 states, some of America's most eye-catching weather phenomena was captured on Boyle's two Canon 6D cameras.
From lightning storms and tornadoes to shots of the Aurora Borealis, these natural displays will take your breath away.
Edge of Stability: 70,000 awe-inspiring photos in one film Boyce operates the website Negative Tilt Photography, which refers to the weather phenomenon of a 'negatively tilted trough'
Storm-chasing photographer Jeff Boyce has created a mesmerising highlight reel of some of the Midwest's most intense weather
In order to capture the 70,000 images used in the video, Boyce travelled nearly 20,000 miles
All images, like this one of the glittering night sky, were captured on two Canon 6D cameras
Boyce operates the website Negative Tilt Photography, which refers to 'negatively tilted trough,' a rare meteorological phenomenon that produces particularly severe weather.
In this particular clip, 70,000 images were used, but on his website, there are hundreds more and many are available as prints.

From toys in Italy to vitamins in Peru: The bizarre items... 16 shares 'My inspiration for photography has always been a desire to capture something spectacular, something unusual and something unique,' Boyce writes on his website.
'This drives me to stand in the path of a violent tornado or in the middle of intense lightning storms, to stay up all night under the stars exposing the hidden Milky Way, or to drive 800 miles in a day in search of something breathtaking.'
Billowing clouds are pictured in a sky that is illuminated in hues of pink, orange and purple
Boyce has been known to drive as far as 800 miles in one day to capture such weather phenomena
A tornado touches down along the barren Midwest grasslands in this stunning screen grab
Hundreds more of these impressive images are available to view and buy online
A stunning cloud formation forms in a purple sky during a brewing storm
In the reel, several Aurora Borealis displays are perfected synched to dubstep music
'You may find it crazy,' he continues. 'And maybe I'm a thrill-seeker, but the themes I most enjoy display the power and beauty of nature and involve severe weather, lightning and beautiful landscapes from across the country.'
Perfectly synched to dubstep music, take a journey through some of Boyce's most impressive shots - from the comfort of your home.
